document_data.name: Fang in the Forest
document_data.caption: The Fang in the Forest.
document_data.mainbody: The '''Fang in the Forest''', formerly known as '''Daerlo's Rest''', was a conical-shaped peak and the southernmost of the [[Earthfast Mountains]]. It was thought to have been an extinct volcano and was said to be partially hollow.
document_data.Inhabitants: The peak was best known as the lair of the ancient [[green dragon]] [[Aglaraerose]]. Deep inside the mountain was her lair, which she named the [[Lure of Jaws]].[[Ed Greenwood]]. "Eye on the Realms:  The Dragon That Never Died." ''[[Dragon magazine|Dragon]] '' #424. Renton, WA: Wizards of the Coast, June, 2013.
document_data.History:
The peak was originally known as "Daerlo's Rest" after [[Daerlo|a local forester]] who was gored by a [[boar]] and laid to rest on the mountainside.

In the later 14th century DR, Aglaraerose built a lair in the mountain and was still believed to inhabit the peak in the late 15th century DR, although she was never seen.[[Ed Greenwood]]. "Eye on the Realms:  The Dragon That Never Died." ''[[Dragon magazine|Dragon]] '' #424. Renton, WA: Wizards of the Coast, June, 2013.
